block.p: Christina Elizabeth Prunier, the senior vice president of Phoenix Pictures, a film production company in Culver City, Calif., was married yesterday to David Armster Doss, the executive producer of NBC's ''Nightly News with Tom Brokaw'' in New York. The Rev. Dr. Walter J. Smith, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony in the chapel of St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church in New York.

Ms. Prunier, 29, is keeping her name. Before joining Phoenix, she was an associate producer for documentaries with HBO, the cable television network. The bride graduated cum laude from Georgetown University.

Christina Elizabeth Prunier, the senior vice president of Phoenix Pictures, a film production company in Culver City, Calif., was married yesterday to David Armster Doss, the executive producer of NBC's ''Nightly News with Tom Brokaw'' in New York. The Rev. Dr. Walter J. Smith, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony in the chapel of St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church in New York.

Ms. Prunier, 29, is keeping her name. Before joining Phoenix, she was an associate producer for documentaries with HBO, the cable television network. The bride graduated cum laude from Georgetown University.
The bride is a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John H. Prunier of Riverside, Conn. Her father is an internist in Greenwich, Conn. Her mother, Suzanne Prunier, is a garden designer in Riverside.

Mr. Doss, 44, had been a producer for ABC News. He graduated from Claremont McKenna College and received a master's degree in journalism from the University of Southern California. He was previously married and divorced.
The bridegroom is the son of Barbara Doss of Seattle and the late Richard Doss. His father was the executive vice president of Frederick & Nelson, a department store chain that was based in Seattle.
